items.title: Notre Dame Football: Pittsburgh Panthers Q&A with Pat Rick of One Foot Down
items.summary: Well folks, we’ve officially reached Q4 (the final 3 regular season games) and it’s CRUNCH TIME when it comes to the Notre Dame Fighting Irish football team achieving their 2025 full-year objectives. The Irish are currently ranked 9th in the weekly College Football Playoff Committee rankings, and with a road matchup against the 22nd-ranked Pittsburgh […]

items.title: STAFF PICKS: #9 Notre Dame Fighting Irish VS #22 Pitt Panthers
items.summary: The Notre Dame Fighting Irish have slowly climbed back up the rankings, and are now ranked #9 in the country in the college football playoff rankings after dismantling Navy, 49-10. Notre Dame travels to #22 Pittsburgh this week to take on the Pitt Panthers with ESPN’s College Gameday covering the entire circus. Despite “Top 25 […]

items.title: Marcus Freeman said, “That Ain’t My Noise”
items.summary: For as excited as we all get for the start of every college football season, it’s the tail end of the season where we often find ourselves in the middle of the loudest parts of the season. The college football playoff rankings, coach firings, National Signing Day, Awards season, Rivalry week, and so much more […]

items.title: 2025 Notre Dame Football: Irish VS Pitt Panthers
items.summary: The 7-2 Notre Dame Fighting Irish are currently ranked #9 by the college football playoff committee and go on the road this week to take on the #22 ranked Pitt Panthers in a NOONER on the rivers. I’m going to be honest with you… the Pitt series always feels a little funny to me. While […]

items.title: Notre Dame Football: Hot and Cold Takes VS. The Pittsburgh Panthers
items.summary: How’d We Do Last Week? Most Wildly Inaccurate This was hilariously wrong. ND finished the game with 0 penalties. Great take to be wrong on though. Most Interesting As a former player, I was wildly in favor of NIL, and HOPED it would bring more parity. We are definitely seeing that…..and as Shane Gillis said, […]

items.title: Throwback Thursday: Notre Dame Fighting Irish Football vs. Pitt (2003) – The Gold Rush
items.summary: My dad grew up in Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania, where sports weren’t just a pastime—they were a way of life. His dad’s sister, Clara, was the family’s ultimate fan, cheering loudest for the Pittsburgh Pirates and, surprisingly, for Notre Dame. She’s the one who taught my dad to love the Irish, and when he was just seven […]

items.title: Notre Dame Football Recruiting: 4-Star California Safety Khalil Terry commits to the Irish
items.summary: On Wednesday, Notre Dame got a big jolt to its 2027 football recruiting class when 4-Star safety Khalil Terry gave his public commitment to Marcus Freeman and the Fighting Irish. The 6’0 185 pounder from Tustin High School in Tustin, California, chose the Irish over a large number of offers including the Tennessee Volunteers, USC […]
